intro: Wyomingia cana, commonly known as the Wyoming spurge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky areas and has small, green leaves with a waxy coating. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Wyomingia cana is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
